posts.post_content:
[Furnace of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of Rath) doesn't always give an instant tie, due to the words "rounded down" on this card. Instead Heartless Hidestugu would reduce all players life totals to 1 or zero depending on whether their life total is odd or even respectively. I think this is much better. All you need to is make sure your's is odd and theirs is even, but this does involve life gain/loss as it's impossible to cause an odd numbered amount of damage with the Furnace in play. My other favourite combos:  
Lifelink on Hidestugu.  
[Grafted Exoskeleton](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grafted Exoskeleton) (especially vs lifegain decks)   
[Pariah's Shield](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pariah's Shield) preferably on [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll) (auto win if your life total is higher than your opponent's, or autowin if you also have the Furnace of Rath out)
posts.html:
Furnace of Rath doesn't always give an instant tie, due to the words "rounded down" on this card. Instead Heartless Hidestugu would reduce all players life totals to 1 or zero depending on whether their life total is odd or even respectively. I think this is much better. All you need to is make sure your's is odd and theirs is even, but this does involve life gain/loss as it's impossible to cause an odd numbered amount of damage with the Furnace in play. My other favourite combos:
Lifelink on Hidestugu.
Grafted Exoskeleton (especially vs lifegain decks)
Pariah's Shield preferably on Stuffy Doll (auto win if your life total is higher than your opponent's, or autowin if you also have the Furnace of Rath out)

posts.post_content:
Yeah, [Lifelink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lifelink) seems like a good idea. Also [Sulfuric Vapors](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sulfuric Vapors)/[Akki Lavarunner](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akki Lavarunner) and [Furnace of Rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of Rath)/[Overblaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overblaze)/[Quest for the Pure Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Quest for the Pure Flame) if you have a way to not kill yourself. Like [Lifelink](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lifelink), but not [Spirit Link](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spirit Link). [Eternity Vessel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eternity Vessel) might also be nice.  
  
As for infect, you can just keep your opponent's life above 19 and yours below 20. [Skyshroud Cutter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skyshroud Cutter) or [Tree of Redemption](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tree of Redemption) or something. Alternately, in multiplayer, you can just threaten to kill everyone.  
  
"NOBODY MOVE OR I'LL BLOW THIS WHOLE GAME TO SMITHEREENS!"  
"Everybody STOP! He's just crazy enough to do it!"  
"Put down the detonator, Jim. We know you're smarter tha-"  
"I SAID NOBODY MOVE!"
posts.html:
Yeah, Lifelink seems like a good idea. Also Sulfuric Vapors/Akki Lavarunner and Furnace of Rath/Overblaze/Quest for the Pure Flame if you have a way to not kill yourself. Like Lifelink, but not Spirit Link. Eternity Vessel might also be nice.

As for infect, you can just keep your opponent's life above 19 and yours below 20. Skyshroud Cutter or Tree of Redemption or something. Alternately, in multiplayer, you can just threaten to kill everyone.

"NOBODY MOVE OR I'LL BLOW THIS WHOLE GAME TO SMITHEREENS!"
"Everybody STOP! He's just crazy enough to do it!"
"Put down the detonator, Jim. We know you're smarter tha-"
"I SAID NOBODY MOVE!"
